lead_paragraph: Manchester United set up the first all-English final in the history of the European Champions League by defeating visiting Barcelona, 1-0, on Tuesday night. Paul Scholes scored on a 25-yard shot to put United in its first Champions League final since 1999. Manchester United, which played to a 0-0 tie at Barcelona last week, won the home-and-home semifinal on aggregate and will meet Chelsea or Liverpool in the final on May 21 in Moscow. Chelsea plays host to Liverpool on Wednesday after a 1-1 tie at Anfield last week.
